Review: Had gifted my sister an O2 spa gift card for her birthday, and visited the Jubilee Hills branch this weekend. And everything about the visit just went wrong:1. They ask you to come 15mins early, we ended up reaching almost half an hour early, and were very happy to hear that they could start our service immediately. This was my sister's first visit, so had booked a couple room. After waiting for 40mins, we were finally told there was no couple room available, and hence the delay. We asked for individual rooms and were led our separate ways. Throughout this wait time, we could hear the employees chatting and laughing and shouting loudly inside the spa - felt like I was in a local beauty parlour, not a relaxing spa. Minus points on the ambience.2. They led me to the first floor, and told me there's some construction going on, but the room will be fine. It wasn't. Firstly, because it faced the road, there was crazy amount of construction noise. And noise of water leaking from the attached washroom. The curtains were translucent at best, and not fully drawn. The therapist just handed me a disposable underwear and went away with zero instructions of how i should cover myself to wait for her. I also couldnt understand why I needed to strip down for a neck + foot massage, and tried to call out to her. But when I opened the door, all I found were construction workers outside. I had to shout at the top of my lungs to get any employee's attention, who then went and found her. This is when I find out that the therapist was preparing me for a full body massage - when I asked her about it, she shrugged and said "Kya pata, management theek se nahin batate (Don't know, the management doesn't tell us properly." She then left, and a completely new person entered the room for the massage. 3. Throughout the massage all I could hear was traffic, employees chatting and shouting, and construction workers outside my room. The bed on which I was lying down was completely dirty at the bottom - which is what I was staring at throughout, and didn't make me feel very hygienic. Eventually i cut it short and decided to not go ahead withe foot massage - they didn't have any pyjamas / disposable clothes for it anyway, and I didn't feel like stripping down for it. Moreover, the massage itself was average, I've had much better experiences at a lower price point. I informed the management about all the issues, and their main response was, we told you there's construction. I told them that given I'm paying full price, and wasn't informed on the phone while taking an appointment, that is no reason for my spa experience to be loud and horrible. I had to again push them to ask their employees to be quieter, at which point the receptionist went in and shouted at the employees to be quiet.4. While my sister had a much better experience (a room away from the construction and noise) - she too faced confusion about which service she had asked for, and was eventually given a robe to wear with no belt, so she couldn't actually shut it. When she enquired about it, the therapist shrugged and said things have been going missing recently, and she has no clue where the belt might be.Overall a super disappointing and stressful experience - at a premium location and spa. In all of this they were trying to sell their membership to us - definitely not taking that, or recommending this place to anyone.Also their feedback link doesn't work properly - so was forced to give a public review.https://www.tripadvisor.in/Attraction_Review-g297586-d8321863-Reviews-or10-Ode_Spa_Hyderabad_Jubilee_Hills-Hyderabad_Hyderabad_District_Telangana.html

Review: Had gifted my sister an O2 spa gift card for her birthday, and visited the Jubilee Hills branch this weekend. And everything about the visit just went wrong:1. They ask you to come 15mins early, we ended up reaching almost half an hour early, and were very happy to hear that they could start our service immediately. We asked for individual rooms and were led our separate ways. Minus points on the ambience.2. They led me to the first floor, and told me there's some construction going on, but the room will be fine. It wasn't. Firstly, because it faced the road, there was crazy amount of construction noise. And noise of water leaking from the attached washroom. The curtains were translucent at best, and not fully drawn. I also couldnt understand why I needed to strip down for a neck + foot massage, and tried to call out to her. But when I opened the door, all I found were construction workers outside. I had to shout at the top of my lungs to get any employee's attention, who then went and found her. This is when I find out that the therapist was preparing me for a full body massage - when I asked her about it, she shrugged and said "Kya pata, management theek se nahin batate (Don't know, the management doesn't tell us properly." She then left, and a completely new person entered the room for the massage. 3. Throughout the massage all I could hear was traffic, employees chatting and shouting, and construction workers outside my room. The bed on which I was lying down was completely dirty at the bottom - which is what I was staring at throughout, and didn't make me feel very hygienic. Eventually i cut it short and decided to not go ahead withe foot massage - they didn't have any pyjamas / disposable clothes for it anyway, and I didn't feel like stripping down for it. I informed the management about all the issues, and their main response was, we told you there's construction. I told them that given I'm paying full price, and wasn't informed on the phone while taking an appointment, that is no reason for my spa experience to be loud and horrible.
